channel.title: [317 Delta]Compile Error
channel.description:
I get this error when i added a dialogue below this case and i dont know what caused this error. I mean it probably is the code. but how to fix?
[code].\src\ActionButtons.java:166: orphaned case case 9158: ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
[code]case 9158:
if(c.NpcDialogue == 5){ // If you have more dialogues that end the dialogue with the 2nd option of a choice, you can add them by using || c.NpcDialogue == ## with ## being the case number c.closeAll(); // This closes the current dialogue } break; if(c.NpcDialogue == 5 || c.NpcDialogue == 9){ c.closeAll(); // This closes the current dialogue } break;[/code]

item.title: [317 Delta]Compile Error
item.dc:creator: @Fall Fall
item.description:
@Fall wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:4, topic:343791”]You defined that case outside of a switch statement

[code=Java]
switch (actionButton) {
case 1:
//stuff
break;

    case 2:
            //stuff
    break;

}
case 9158:
//stuff
break;[/code][/quote]

Now i get this.

.\src\ActionButtons.java:1895: class, interface, or enum expected }→ ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.title: [317 Delta]Compile Error
item.dc:creator: @Fall Fall
item.description:
@Fall wrote:

deathschaos9:

An orphaned case is a case lying outside of a switch statement.

What do you mean by that?

item.title: [317 Delta]Compile Error
item.dc:creator: @Fall Fall
item.description:
@Fall wrote:

I get this error when i added a dialogue below this case and i dont know what caused this error. I mean it probably is the code. but how to fix?

.\src\ActionButtons.java:166: orphaned case case 9158: ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

[code]case 9158:

    if(c.NpcDialogue == 5){ // If you have more dialogues that end the dialogue with the 2nd option of a choice, you can add them by using || c.NpcDialogue == ## with ## being the case number
            c.closeAll(); // This closes the current dialogue

}
break;
if(c.NpcDialogue == 5 || c.NpcDialogue == 9){
c.closeAll(); // This closes the current dialogue
}
break;[/code]
